numbered_ace_sentences: 2. If a student is richer and the student has legacy parents then the student is more likely to get admitted.
3. A student has a decent chance to get admitted to an elite college only if the student has immense privilege.
5. Poorer students have a higher chance to get admitted than wealthier non-legacy students.
6. I wonder why poorer students have a higher chance to get admitted than wealthier non-legacy students.
7. I wonder how much the trauma essay affects this difference.
8. I will apply to college soon.
9. This information makes me realize that college admissions can be complicated.
10. This information makes me realize that college admissions can be competitive.
11. A student's station in life is a huge factor in the colleges that the student can go to.
12. A student's station in life is a huge factor in the colleges that the student cannot go to.
13. This factor is prevalent in the minds of students.
14. This factor is prevalent in the minds of parents.
17. The headline is: Ivy Leagues are elite schools or elitists.
